title: Blueprint
description: A Tempo blueprint describing forms, fields and visualizations. IDs of fields, forms and visualizations must contain only letters, digits, hyphens and semicolons

id.description: A unique id for the blueprint. If needed, use semicolons as a namespace separator

label.description: A human readable name for the blueprint

fields.description: A list of fields that can be used to build forms in this blueprint

id.description: A unique id for the field

label.description: A human readable name for the field

unit.description: A unit to be displayed near the field

type.description: The type of data stored in the field

default.description: A default value for the field

min.description: For number fields, a minimum value used for validation

max.description: For number fields, a maximum value used for validation

step.description: For number fields, step used for increments / decrements. Default to any.

suggestions.description: Text and number fields, offer a list of suggestions for easier selection

forms.description: A list of forms exposed by this blueprint

id.description: A unique id for the form

label.description: A human readable name for the form

fields.description: A list of fields used to build the form

items.description: Configuration of each field of this form. Only the field id is required, but all supported fields options can be overriden here.

id.description: A list of fields used to build the form

required.description: Indicate if the field is required or not. Defaults to true.

visualizations.description: A list of visualizations available in this blueprint

label.description: A human readable name for the visualization

help.description: A help text to be displayed near the visualization to provide context
examples: Total amount spent per day, in dollars
Restaurants ranked by numbor of orders

query.description: A SQL query used to build the visualization. Please refer to Tempo's documentation on how to build visualization queries.
examples: SELECT data->`bob:purchase:restaurant`, sum(data->`bob:purchase:price`) as 'Amount Spent' FROM ? GROUP BY data->`bob:purchase:restaurant` ORDER BY 'Amount Spent' DESC

displayType.description: The type of chart used for the visualization

displayOptions.description: Options to tweak the rendering of the visualization. Please refer to Tempo's documentation on how to build visualizations.
